title: How to Change Your Apple ID

steps.title: Sign out of Apple ID.
steps.content: Sign out of Apple ID. Do so on all devices and services, such as iCloud and iTunes, that you're signed into with your current Apple ID.

steps.title: Go to the Apple ID website.
steps.content: Go to the Apple ID website . Do so by clicking the link to the left or by typing appleid.apple.com in the search field of any Internet-connected Web browser.

steps.title: Enter your current Apple ID and password in the labeled fields.
steps.content: Enter your current Apple ID and password in the labeled fields.

steps.title: Click on or tap ➲.
steps.content: Click on or tap ➲. It's on the right side of the "Password" field. If you have two-step verification enabled, tap or click on "Allow" on another device, then enter the six-digit code in the spaces on the screen.

steps.title: Click on or tap Edit.
steps.content: Click on or tap Edit . It's a blue link on the right side of the screen under the "Account" section.

steps.title: Click on or tap Change Email Address.
steps.content: Click on or tap Change Email Address . It's next to the email address under the "APPLE ID" section at the top of the window. [2] X Expert Source Luigi Oppido Computer & Tech Specialist Expert Interview. 24 March 2021 If your Apple ID ends in @mac.com, @me.com, or @iCloud.com, you will not see this option.

steps.title: Enter a new email address.
steps.content: Enter a new email address. Use an address that's neither already associated with an Apple ID nor likely to change soon. [3] X Expert Source Luigi Oppido Computer & Tech Specialist Expert Interview. 24 March 2021 If prompted, answer the security questions you set up with your Apple ID.

steps.title: Click on or tap Next.
steps.content: Click on or tap Next . Apple will send an email with a verification code to your new email address. The button may read Continue , depending on the browser you're using.

steps.title: Check your email.
steps.content: Check your email. Look for the message sent by Apple.

steps.title: Enter the verification code.
steps.content: Enter the verification code. Type the code from the email message in the spaces that appear in the browser window.

steps.title: Sign in with your new Apple ID.
steps.content: Sign in with your new Apple ID. You can now sign back in to your devices and Apple services with your new Apple ID. If you have two-step verification enabled, tap or click on "Allow" on another device, then enter the six-digit code in the spaces on the screen.

steps.title: Sign out of Apple ID.
steps.content: Sign out of Apple ID. Do so on all devices and services, such as iCloud and iTunes, that you're signed into with your current Apple ID, EXCEPT the device you're using to change your Apple ID.

steps.title: Open Settings.
steps.content: Open Settings. It's a gray app with gears (⚙️) that's typically located on your home screen.

steps.title: Tap your Apple ID.
steps.content: Tap your Apple ID. It's the section at the top of the screen that contains your name and image, if you've added one.

steps.title: Tap Name, Phone Numbers, Email.
steps.content: Tap Name, Phone Numbers, Email . It's at the top of the first section.

steps.title: Tap Edit.
steps.content: Tap Edit . It's a blue link on the right side of the screen next to "REACHABLE AT."

steps.title: Swipe left on your current Apple ID.
steps.content: Swipe left on your current Apple ID. It's the first email address in the list, with the words "Apple ID" in small text just below it. On some devices, you may need to tap a " - " next to the email address rather than swiping left. If your Apple ID ends in @mac.com, @me.com, or @iCloud.com, you will not be able to swipe left.

steps.title: Tap Delete.
steps.content: Tap Delete . It's a red button to the right of your Apple ID.

steps.title: Tap Continue.
steps.content: Tap Continue . You'll be prompted to choose another email address already associated with your Apple ID, if there is one, or to enter a new email address.

steps.title: Enter a new email address.
steps.content: Enter a new email address. Use an address that's neither already associated with an Apple ID nor likely to change soon. If prompted, answer the security questions you set up with your Apple ID or your Apple ID password.

steps.title: Click on Next.
steps.content: Click on Next . Apple will send an email with a verification code to your new email address.

steps.title: Check your email.
steps.content: Check your email. Look for the message sent by Apple.

steps.title: Enter the verification code.
steps.content: Enter the verification code. Type the code from the email message in the spaces that appear on your device's screen.

steps.title: Sign in with your new Apple ID.
steps.content: Sign in with your new Apple ID. You can now sign back in to your devices and Apple services with your new Apple ID. If you have two-step verification enabled, tap or click on "Allow" on another device, then enter the six-digit code in the spaces on the screen.
